Description: Upper body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with root of handle; interior: glazed black; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with broad band between; handle root and wall below glazed; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (possibly)
Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as coming from a Type 9A or Type 5C South Ionian cup with everted rim. These cups closely follow the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups and coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 or B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are rare at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 22.2.35)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 49, no. 26)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.145) (Phase 3)
